trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog release notes
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog release notes

trans-unit.source: Release notes for the 28 August 2015 public preview release of Azure Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: Release notes for the 28 August 2015 public preview release of Azure Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog release notes
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog release notes

trans-unit.source: Notes for the 28 August 2015 release of Azure Data Catalog
trans-unit.target: Notes for the 28 August 2015 release of Azure Data Catalog

trans-unit.source: Data profile missing for some registered data assets
trans-unit.target: Data profile missing for some registered data assets

trans-unit.source: When registering data sources with the data profiling option selected in the data source registration tool, the data profile information may not be included in the following scenarios:
trans-unit.target: When registering data sources with the data profiling option selected in the data source registration tool, the data profile information may not be included in the following scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database tables
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database tables

trans-unit.source: SQL Server tables and views where there are multiple objects with the same name in different schemas
trans-unit.target: SQL Server tables and views where there are multiple objects with the same name in different schemas

trans-unit.source: SQL Server tables and views with column names greater than 118 characters
trans-unit.target: SQL Server tables and views with column names greater than 118 characters

trans-unit.source: Oracle tables and views with column names greater than 20 characters
trans-unit.target: Oracle tables and views with column names greater than 20 characters

trans-unit.source: Oracle tables and views with spaces or multu-byte characters in column names
trans-unit.target: Oracle tables and views with spaces or multu-byte characters in column names

trans-unit.source: These restrictions are due to a known issue in the August 28 release, and will be addressed in a future update to Azure Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: These restrictions are due to a known issue in the August 28 release, and will be addressed in a future update to Azure Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: Notes for the 13 July 2015 release of Azure Data Catalog
trans-unit.target: Notes for the 13 July 2015 release of Azure Data Catalog

trans-unit.source: Registering and Connecting to Oracle Database
trans-unit.target: Registering and Connecting to Oracle Database

trans-unit.source: When connecting to Oracle Database data sources users must have installed the correct Oracle drivers that match the bitness (32-bit or 64-bit) of the software being used.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to Oracle Database data sources users must have installed the correct Oracle drivers that match the bitness (32-bit or 64-bit) of the software being used.

trans-unit.source: When registering Oracle data sources on a computer running 32-bit Windows, the 32-bit Oracle drivers will be used
trans-unit.target: When registering Oracle data sources on a computer running 32-bit Windows, the 32-bit Oracle drivers will be used

trans-unit.source: When registering Oracle data sources on a computer running 64-bit Windows, the 64-bit Oracle drivers will be used
trans-unit.target: When registering Oracle data sources on a computer running 64-bit Windows, the 64-bit Oracle drivers will be used

trans-unit.source: When connecting to Oracle data sources using Excel on a computer running the 32-bit version of Microsoft Office, including on 64-bit Windows, the 32-bit Oracle drivers will be used
trans-unit.target: When connecting to Oracle data sources using Excel on a computer running the 32-bit version of Microsoft Office, including on 64-bit Windows, the 32-bit Oracle drivers will be used

trans-unit.source: When connecting to Oracle data sources using Excel on a computer running the 64-bit version of Microsoft Office, the 64-bit Oracle drivers will be used
trans-unit.target: When connecting to Oracle data sources using Excel on a computer running the 64-bit version of Microsoft Office, the 64-bit Oracle drivers will be used

trans-unit.source: Registering and connecting to SQL Server Reporting Services
trans-unit.target: Registering and connecting to SQL Server Reporting Services

trans-unit.source: Support for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) data sources in the initial preview release of Azure Data Catalog is limited to Native Mode servers only.
trans-unit.target: Support for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) data sources in the initial preview release of Azure Data Catalog is limited to Native Mode servers only.

trans-unit.source: Support for SSRS in SharePoint mode will be added in a later release.
trans-unit.target: Support for SSRS in SharePoint mode will be added in a later release.

trans-unit.source: Opening data assets in Excel
trans-unit.target: Opening data assets in Excel

trans-unit.source: When opening data assets in Microsoft Excel from the Azure Data Catalog portal, users may be prompted with a **Microsoft Excel Security Notice** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: When opening data assets in Microsoft Excel from the Azure Data Catalog portal, users may be prompted with a **Microsoft Excel Security Notice** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: This is standard, expected behavior, and users can select **Enable** to continue.
trans-unit.target: This is standard, expected behavior, and users can select **Enable** to continue.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable or disable security alerts about links and files from suspicious websites](https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Enable-or-disable-security-alerts-about-links-and-files-from-suspicious-websites-A1AC6AE9-5C4A-4EB3-B3F8-143336039BBE).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable or disable security alerts about links and files from suspicious websites](https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Enable-or-disable-security-alerts-about-links-and-files-from-suspicious-websites-A1AC6AE9-5C4A-4EB3-B3F8-143336039BBE).

trans-unit.source: BLOB and UDT columns missing in previews
trans-unit.target: BLOB and UDT columns missing in previews

trans-unit.source: When registering tables and views that contain binary large object (BLOB) and user-defined data type (UDT) columns, and selecting to include preview for the data assets, these columns will not be included in the preview.
trans-unit.target: When registering tables and views that contain binary large object (BLOB) and user-defined data type (UDT) columns, and selecting to include preview for the data assets, these columns will not be included in the preview.

trans-unit.source: Proxy and policy configuration and data source registration
trans-unit.target: Proxy and policy configuration and data source registration

trans-unit.source: Users may encounter a situation where they can log on to the Azure Data Catalog portal, but when they attempt to log on to the data source registration tool they encounter an error message that prevents them from logging on.
trans-unit.target: Users may encounter a situation where they can log on to the Azure Data Catalog portal, but when they attempt to log on to the data source registration tool they encounter an error message that prevents them from logging on.

trans-unit.source: There are two potential causes for this problem behavior:
trans-unit.target: There are two potential causes for this problem behavior:

trans-unit.source: **Cause 1: Active Directory Federation Services Configuration**
trans-unit.target: **Cause 1: Active Directory Federation Services Configuration**

trans-unit.source: The data source registration tool uses Forms Authentication to validate user logons against Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The data source registration tool uses Forms Authentication to validate user logons against Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For successful logon, Forms Authentication must be enabled in the Global Authentication Policy by an Active Directory administrator.
trans-unit.target: For successful logon, Forms Authentication must be enabled in the Global Authentication Policy by an Active Directory administrator.

trans-unit.source: In some situations, this error behavior may occur only when the user is on the company network, or only when the user is connecting from outside the company network.
trans-unit.target: In some situations, this error behavior may occur only when the user is on the company network, or only when the user is connecting from outside the company network.

trans-unit.source: The Global Authentication Policy allows authentication methods to be enabled separately for intranet and extranet connections.
trans-unit.target: The Global Authentication Policy allows authentication methods to be enabled separately for intranet and extranet connections.

trans-unit.source: Logon errors may occur if Forms Authentication is not enabled for the network from which the user is connecting.
trans-unit.target: Logon errors may occur if Forms Authentication is not enabled for the network from which the user is connecting.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Configuring intranet forms-based authentication for devices that do not support WIA](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn727110.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Configuring intranet forms-based authentication for devices that do not support WIA](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn727110.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **Cause 2: Network Proxy Configuration**
trans-unit.target: **Cause 2: Network Proxy Configuration**

trans-unit.source: If the corporate network uses a proxy server, the registration tool may not be able to connect to Azure Active Directory through the proxy.
trans-unit.target: If the corporate network uses a proxy server, the registration tool may not be able to connect to Azure Active Directory through the proxy.

trans-unit.source: Users can ensure that the registration tool by editing the tool’s configuration file, adding this section to the file:
trans-unit.target: Users can ensure that the registration tool by editing the tool’s configuration file, adding this section to the file:

trans-unit.source: To locate the RegistrationTool.exe.config file, launch the registration tool, and then open the Windows Task Manager utility.
trans-unit.target: To locate the RegistrationTool.exe.config file, launch the registration tool, and then open the Windows Task Manager utility.

trans-unit.source: On the Details tab in Task manager, right-click on RegistrationTool.exe and choose Open file location from the pop-up menu.
trans-unit.target: On the Details tab in Task manager, right-click on RegistrationTool.exe and choose Open file location from the pop-up menu.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
